channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4350] What's wrong with our economy?
[+2184] WTF: Man Arrested for Being Naked in His OWN HOME
item.description: A 29-year-old Springfield man says he was making coffee in the nude was arrested after a neighbor saw him. "Yes, I wasn't wearing any clothes but I was alone, in my own home and just got out of bed. It was dark and I had no idea anyone was outside looking in at me," Williamson said.

item.title: [+2092] I think I forgot to close the window [PIC]
[+1642] Mythbusters test golf ball dimpling effect on fuel economy
item.description: The Mythbusters must be closet car fans, because the hour-long show on the Discovery Channel seems to be producing more and more experiments involving automobiles than ever before. Their latest again involves fuel efficiency, this time testing if a dirty car is more fuel efficient than a clean one because of the golf ball-like dimpling effect.

item.title: [+1513] What NOT to Serve at a Kids' Birthday Party (PIC)
item.description: ...and 20 minutes later, all that could be heard was the sound of five little hearts exploding.

item.title: [+1277] Barack Obama sees worst poll rating drop in 50 years
item.description: The decline in Barack Obama's popularity since July has been the steepest of any president at the same stage of his first term for more than 50 years ago.

item.title: [+1188] Net neutrality: John McCain 'NO!' Glenn Beck 'Marxist Plot!'
item.description: Sen. John McCain introduced a bill late Thursday that would short-circuit the FCC's ability to enforce its proposed open Internet rules. Meanwhile, Glenn Beck has blasted net neutrality as a "Marxist" plot by the Obama administration to take over the Internet.

item.title: [+1159] Linus Torvalds gives Windows 7 a big thumbs up
item.description: You know Microsoft, when you setup a big Windows 7 booth across the street from the Japan Linux Symposium you're just asking for trouble.

item.title: [+1082] Strangest Costume Want Ad Ever (PIC)
item.description: Wow. Words fail me. What a perfectionist! More power to this guy if he found someone to answer this ad.

item.title: [+908] Hosting Your Windows 7 Torrenting Party
item.description: Be a part of Windows history by hosting your own Windows 7 torrenting party.

item.title: [+886] Grayson: Fox News is the "enemy of America"
item.description: "Fox News and their Republican collaborators are the enemy of America. They're the enemy of anybody who cares about health care, the enemy of anybody who cares about educating their children, the enemy of anybody who wants energy independence or anything good for this country. And certainly the enemy of peace, there's no doubt about that."

item.title: [+774] McCain introduces bill to block Net neutrality
item.description: Sen. John McCain (R-AZ) introduced a bill in the Senate on Thursday that would effectively allow Internet service providers to slow down or block Internet content or applications of their choosing.

item.title: [+773] Open for Business [PIC]
item.description: I'll take a dozen glazed and one severed foot please.

item.title: [+761] Backfire! NC GOP-er Delivers Anti-Republican Survey Comments
item.description: When North Carolina state senator Phil Berger (R) trucked a wheelbarrow stacked with Republican surveys into the governor's office, he thought he was delivering a neat blow to Democratic Gov. Bev Perdue. Hilarity then ensues.

item.title: [+701] Franken's Anti-Rape Amendment May Be Stripped By Inouye
item.description: An amendment that would prevent the gov. from working with contractors who denied victims of assault the right to bring their case to court is in danger of being watered down or stripped entirely from a larger defense appropriations bill. Multiple sources have told the HuffPo that Sen. Inouye, D=HI, is is considering removing or altering the prov..

item.title: [+694] Ninite Easy Multi-App Installer - Great For Win7 Upgrades
item.description: The easiest way to get apps.1. Pick the apps you want.2. Start your customized installer.3. You're done!

item.title: [+580] High Time to Legalize? (Infographic)
item.description: Have you ever wondered which states have made marijuana legal for medical use? What about where marijuana use has been decriminalized? The following map illustrates which states have passed more progressive marijuana-related legislature, and offers insight to the prevalence and associated costs of marijuana-related offenses.

item.title: [+578] Thousands Protest Global Warming [PIC]
[+573] The Weirdest Clouds that You'll Ever See
item.description: A look at some amazing photographs of the weirdest cloud formations that you'll ever see, that are destined to inspire your design work and surely blow your mind.

item.title: [+534] Breaching Men's Room Etiquette
item.description: You would think every man knows urinal etiquette. You would be wrong. Join us as we take a look at several of the worst offenders you may encounter in the Men's Room.
